title: How to Install and Use MongoDB on Windows
desc: MongoDB is a popular NoSQL database used for storing JSON-like documents. If you’re a Windows user and want to start working with MongoDB, this guide is for you. We’ll walk through installation, setup, and basic usage.Keywords:MongoDB, Windows, NoSQL, MongoDB installation, MongoDB commands, MongoDB Compass, MongoDB shell, JSON database

title: Introduction to MongoDB and Compass
desc: MongoDB is a popular NoSQL database that stores data in flexible, JSON-like documents. Unlike traditional SQL databases, it doesn't require predefined schemas. This makes MongoDB especially useful for modern applications that deal with large, evolving, or unstructured datasets — such as those used in mobile apps, real-time analytics, IoT, or e-commerce platforms.

title: Mastering MongoDB Queries: Insert, Find, Update, Delete and More
desc: Mastering MongoDB Queries: Insert, Find, Update, Delete and More MongoDB is a powerful NoSQL database that uses a flexible, document-based model. In this guide, you’ll learn how to use key MongoDB queries including: Insert, Find, Update, and Delete. This is perfect for beginners and those switching from SQL to NoSQL

title: Service Finder — Flutter Implementation Plan
desc: Mobile app to search and hire local service workers (electricians, plumbers, carpenters). Roles: Admin, Secretary, Worker, Consumer. Backed by a REST API (users, worker_service, requests, payments, reviews, notifications).

title: Service Finder — ER Diagram & Database Schema
desc: This post provides a ready-to-use database schema and a simple ER diagram for a marketplace-style service app. The schema includes additional tables for payments, notifications, and locations. Use these SQL snippets to create the tables or adapt them for your preferred RDBMS (MySQL / MariaDB / PostgreSQL).

title: State Management by Provider in Flutter
desc: What is Provider?  Provider is a wrapper around InheritedWidget, allowing efficient and scalable state management. It's officially recommended by Google for managing state and dependencies in Flutter.

title: Understanding Regular Expressions in JavaScript
desc: Understanding JavaScript Regular Expressions. In JavaScript, a regular expression (or RegExp) is a pattern used to match character combinations in strings. You define them using a special syntax that starts and ends with forward slashes: /pattern/flags.

title: Validation using JavaScript
desc: This post demonstrates how to validate user input using JavaScript in two ways:Directly when a button is clicked (without form submission) submission We’ll use HTML attributes like required along with JavaScript functions for extra checks
